content.raw:
After a collapse of the robot I restarted task 1 / checkpoint 4. The re-harness left the robot discombobulated. The feet were tangled although the controller moved them to achieve a stable position as shown in the first two pictures. 

The third picture is after another 1.4 restart. The dropping of the harness stopped at state 4 and never completed the harness action. 

A third restart of 1.4 provided a stable stance. 

I think the re-harness is not exactly the same as the original harness at the start. I've tried to verify and capture this with pictures but can't. It appears to me that the robot's limbs are more loose on the re-harness so the legs can dangle further and remain in contact with the floor. In the startup harness the robot contracts all the limbs and then loosens. 

BTW this is causing some big changes in my code since the robot pose is not maintained and has to be reestablished after a re-harness.
